attributes.action: Do not amend the Human Rights Act to make vaccines mandatory.
attributes.additional_details: Promote autonomy and choice. In Breach of other regulations by amending this legislation
attributes.background: Revoke the ability to amend the Human Rights Act, to remove autonomy and choice regarding persons and there right to choose whether or not they have a vaccine

rejection.details:
It is already against the law for people to be required to undergo medical treatment, including vaccinations. The Coronavirus Act 2020 has not changed this.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Do not rollout Covid-19 vaccine passports: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/569957

Do not require health and social care workers to take covid-19 vaccination: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/577842

Outlaw discrimination against those who do not get a Covid-19 vaccination: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/575801

Prohibit employers from requiring employees to have a Covid-19 vaccine: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/575607

If you wanted the Government to create additional protections for people who do not wanted to be vaccinated against Covid-19, you could start a new petition, but you would need to provide your full name.
